Description: Rim and body fragment of South Ionian pottery stemmed plate with narrow flat rim; cream slip; exterior: three horizontal bands with base-rays below; interior: wild goats grazing to right, framed by glaze bands with added red bands and traces of added white; filling ornaments: triangles, quartered lozenge with dots and dotted rosette; on the rim paired hook meanders. Drill hole on broken edge from sampling for clay analysis.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
From same plate as University College London, UCL-190.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 11)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.915)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.17)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
